benchmark_details.name: SwiftEval
benchmark_details.overview: SwiftEval is the first Swift-oriented benchmark consisting of 28 carefully hand-crafted problems designed to evaluate LLM coding capabilities specifically for the Swift programming language.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a high-quality evaluation method specifically tailored to the Swift programming language.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SwiftEval currently contains 28 problems, which is significantly fewer than other benchmarks like HumanEval or MBPP.

data.source: Manually crafted problems designed by an industry Software Engineer with deep Swift knowledge.

methodology.calculation: Pass@k is calculated based on the number of unit tests that the generated code passes.
methodology.interpretation: A higher pass@k score indicates better performance in generating correct code for the given problems.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative results reported against the HumanEval benchmark using various Code LLMs.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted using 44 popular Code LLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International License (CC BY-NC-ND 4.0)
